textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.env module¶

class textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.env.SudokuEnv(difficulty: str | None = 'easy', max_turns: int | None = 5)[source]¶

Bases: Env

Sudoku Game Environment

is_safe(grid: List[List[int]], row: int, col: int, num: int) → bool[source]¶

Checks if it’s safe to place a number in a given cell.

Parameters:

  • grid (List[List[int]]) – The Sudoku grid.

  • row (int) – Row index.

  • col (int) – Column index.

  • num (int) – Number to place.

Returns:

True if safe, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

property offline_renderer¶
render()[source]¶

Renders the current state of the Sudoku grid.

Returns:

The rendered game state.

Return type:

str

reset(seed: int | None = None) → dict[int, List[Tuple[int, str]]] | None[source]¶

Reset the game environment.

Parameters:

seed (int) – The random seed for the game.

Returns:

  • observations (Optional[Dict[int, str]]): Initial observations for the player.

  • info (Dict[str, Any]): Additional information.

Return type:

Tuple containing

step(action: str) → Tuple[dict[int, List[Tuple[int, str]]] | None, Dict[int, int] | None, bool, bool, Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Take a step in the game environment given an action from a player.

Parameters:

  • player_id (int) – The ID of the player taking the action.

  • action (str) – The action taken by the player.

Returns:

Observations for the player after the action. - rewards (Optional[Dict[int, float]]): Rewards for the player after the action. - truncated (bool): Whether the episode has been truncated. - terminated (bool): Whether the episode has ended. - info (Dict[str, Any]): Additional information.

Return type:

  • observations (Optional[Dict[int, str]])

test_cases = {'correct_move_easy': {'actions': ['[6 4 4]', '[7 3 3]'], 'difficulty': 'easy'}, 'invalid_format_easy': {'actions': ['row 3 col 2 4'], 'difficulty': 'easy'}, 'invalid_move_easy': {'actions': ['[7 3 9]', '[1 2 5]'], 'difficulty': 'easy'}, 'out_of_bounds_easy': {'actions': ['[10 3 5]'], 'difficulty': 'easy'}, 'overwrite_pre_filled_easy': {'actions': ['[2 1 7]'], 'difficulty': 'easy'}}¶
test_sudoku_outcomes = None¶
test_sudoku_outcomes_0_correct_move_easy(**kw)¶

Test various Sudoku outcomes using predefined action sequences across different difficulty levels [with name=’correct_move_easy’, difficulty=’easy’, action_sequence=[‘[6 4 4]’, ‘[7 3 3]’]].

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Test case name.

  • difficulty (str) – Difficulty level of the Sudoku environment.

  • action_sequence (List[str]) – List of action strings to execute.

test_sudoku_outcomes_1_invalid_format_easy(**kw)¶

Test various Sudoku outcomes using predefined action sequences across different difficulty levels [with name=’invalid_format_easy’, difficulty=’easy’, action_sequence=[‘row 3 col 2 4’]].

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Test case name.

  • difficulty (str) – Difficulty level of the Sudoku environment.

  • action_sequence (List[str]) – List of action strings to execute.

  • difficulty (str) – Difficulty level of the Sudoku environment.

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.generate_correct_move_sequence()[source]¶

Generates an action sequence leading to a correct completion of a Sudoku puzzle. Note: This assumes that the board setup supports the sequence.

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.generate_invalid_format_sequence()[source]¶

Generates an action sequence with an invalid move format.

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.generate_invalid_move_sequence()[source]¶

Generates an action sequence where the move violates Sudoku rules (duplicate in row/column/subgrid).

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.generate_out_of_bounds_sequence()[source]¶

Generates an action sequence with out-of-bounds row or column numbers.

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.generate_overwrite_pre_filled_sequence()[source]¶

Generates an action sequence where a player attempts to overwrite a pre-filled cell.

textarena.envs.single_player.Sudoku.test.run_unit_test()[source]¶
